backend.integrations.airtable module

async backend.integrations.airtable.authorize_airtable(user_id, org_id)[source]

Initiates the Airtable OAuth2 authorization flow.

Generates a unique state and code verifier, stores them in Redis, and returns the Airtable authorization URL.

Parameters:

  • user_id (str) – The ID of the user initiating the authorization.

  • org_id (str) – The ID of the organization.

Returns:

The Airtable authorization URL.

Return type:

str

async backend.integrations.airtable.oauth2callback_airtable(request: Request)[source]

Handles the OAuth2 callback from Airtable.

Validates the state, exchanges the authorization code for an access token, and stores the credentials in Redis.

Parameters:

request (fastapi.Request) – The FastAPI request object containing query parameters.

Raises:

HTTPException – If an OAuth error occurs, state mismatch, or token exchange fails.

Returns:

An HTML response to close the browser window.

Return type:

fastapi.responses.HTMLResponse

async backend.integrations.airtable.get_airtable_credentials(user_id, org_id)[source]

Retrieves Airtable credentials for a given user and organization from Redis.

Deletes the credentials from Redis after retrieval.

Parameters:

  • user_id (str) – The ID of the user.

  • org_id (str) – The ID of the organization.

Raises:

HTTPException – If no credentials are found.

Returns:

A dictionary containing the Airtable credentials.

Return type:

dict

backend.integrations.airtable.create_integration_item_metadata_object(response_json, item_type, parent_id=None, parent_name=None) → IntegrationItem[source]

Creates an IntegrationItem object from Airtable response data.

Parameters:

  • response_json (dict) – The JSON response from the Airtable API.

  • item_type (str) – The type of the item (e.g., “Base”, “Table”).

  • parent_id (Optional[str]) – The ID of the parent item, defaults to None.

  • parent_name (Optional[str]) – The name of the parent item, defaults to None.

Returns:

An IntegrationItem object.

Return type:

IntegrationItem

backend.integrations.airtable.fetch_items(access_token, url, aggregated_response: list, offset=None)[source]

Recursively fetches items from Airtable API with pagination.

Appends fetched items to the aggregated_response list.

Parameters:

  • access_token (str) – The Airtable access token.

  • url (str) – The API endpoint URL to fetch from.

  • aggregated_response (list) – A list to accumulate the fetched items.

  • offset (Optional[str]) – The offset for pagination, defaults to None.

async backend.integrations.airtable.get_items_airtable(credentials) → list[dict][source]

Fetches Airtable bases and tables for a given set of credentials.

Checks for cached items in Redis. If not found, fetches from Airtable API, creates IntegrationItem objects, and caches the results.

Parameters:

credentials (str) – A JSON string containing the Airtable access token.

Raises:

HTTPException – If fetching items fails or an unexpected error occurs.

Returns:

A list of dictionaries, each representing an Airtable base or table.

Return type:

list[dict]
